did.unittitle: Robert Chambers collection relating to William Wagner and the history of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

scopecontent.p: This collection of documents relates chiefly to William Wagner (1796-1885), his businesses, and the Wagner Free Institute of Science gathered from Institute records by Robert Chambers, the Institute's director from 1945-1980. Papers and records on the life of William Wagner document his employ as a supercargo for Stephen Girard from 1810-1819; his businesses Snowden & Wagner from 1819-1825 and the Lennoxville Steam Saw Mill from 1825-1828; his collection of specimens and writings; as well as his marriages to Caroline Moore Say and Louisa Binney (1814-1898). Documents of the Wagner Free Institute of Science chiefly cover its early founding by William Wagner and its expansion after his death. The bulk of the records, 1884-1900, concern the Institute's finances, development of the museum, university extension program, establishment of a branch of the Free Library of Philadelphia, museum and library acquisitions, and early publication history of the Transactions of the Wagner Free Institute of Science.
